title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 18) (Treatment Benefit- 
Payment by the Minister) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020. 

Commencement

title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: 3. Article 105(2) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments
text_raw:
3. Article 105(2) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments 
and Control) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the 
insertion of “or the United Kingdom,” after “Member State”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 December, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [716] 3

title: Social Welfare Act 2016 (No. 15 of 2016)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Currently, article 105(2) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments 
and Control) Regulations 2007 provides that dental, optical or medical 
appliance treatment benefits covered by the Treatment Benefit Scheme, can be 
obtained in another Member State and the amount which would have been 
payable, as the case may be, to the audiologist, dentist, dispensing optician, 
ophthalmologist or optometrist -if the treatment was obtained in this State- will 
be payable to the claimant. 

After the United Kingdom withdraws from the European Union, the effect of 
these Regulations will be to preserve the current position whereby a person 
who receives eligible treatment in the United Kingdom, continues to be entitled 
to receive the amount payable for the same treatment in this State. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [716]
